text: 3 hours!!! It was so heavy i couldn't watch it all at once, but i had to split it in 2. And it was still heavy to watch. Dumb action packed movie only an idiot would like. Luckily, this was the last one. I hope so. Can't get any weirder than the last two movies.
You have to watch it because it was the finale, but story line and plot of both part I and II weren’t very good.
Hammy acting, Tom Cruise looking far too old, awful plot, self-indulgent. Watched it on a long-haul flight just to kill the time, which is really the only place and time to watch it.
Even though it's a blockbuster, the story has serious intellectual depth. Great performance from the amazing cast. Not to be dismissed as a big budget crowd pleaser alone. It has serious brains.

I don't know what it was but, to me, this film was a letdown.  The stunts seemed unoriginal and lacking in their usual flair.  Maybe the franchise had run its course and nothing new to offer. Not the sendoff I was hoping for.
Script wasn't the best and some weak characters in it. Not as good as it's predecessors but worth watching all the same.

These movies are funny because you know the worst possible thing is going to happen to Hunt and his team (and in a 3 hour movie that’s a lot of bad scenarios). But you also know that they are going to find a way out of it. Yet despite the predictability I was on the edge of my seat the entire movie. (68%)

Greetings from Lithuania.

"Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning" (2025) is the latest and according to creators the last Mission Impossible movie. Well at least for now - in my opinion. If this movie did well as lets say "Maverik" at the box office, there wouldn't be any Final mission yet, that is for sure. 

I wasn't the biggest fan of previous movie, and therefore i haven't had big hopes for this one. After seeing it i can say that I liked it, but not loved it. It features some of the most impressive action set pieces in this franchise - the U-boat sequence was pretty incredible. Reminded me of "The Abyss" a bit. But the problem with this movie as well as with the previous one if the story overall. It is just way to big and sometimes convoluted - like every single live on earth now depends of Ethan Hunt, it was just to much for me. I liked when conflicts were on a smaller scale like in first movies - the Armageddon scenario didn't work for me. The length of this movie is also a bit of a problem. To tell this story run time 2 h 40 min shouldn't have been this bloated. It does dragg, but less than i expected it to drag. 

Overall,  "The Final Reckoning" is a descent movie at the end of the day, a pretty good one actually considering the craftsmanship, stunts and sets - this is a big movie which unfortunately stumbled on its bloated premise.

A pretty final film to close the franchise. Overall, it delivers a few amazing action sequences and has Mquery’s signature style. The film manages to keep you interested although it’s never as great as its last to predecessors. Still, for Mission Impossible fans and those who appreciate good action and acting, I recommend it.

A worthy end to this franchise. The two main stunts in the movie are breathtaking and suspenseful, and there is an effective sense of dread that looms of the story. The writing can be a bit cheesy though, but often in an entertaining way; they keep saying 'it is written' whenever anything happens. A lot of the dialogue is exposition, which drags the film down a bit.
very long and too many characters

Storyline is incredibly weak and so many holes/glossed over patches. Plus can we stop with the ridiculous number of flashbacks and long glances at each other?? Disappointing end to the series for sure...but WAIT they've left it open to extension yet again! Thanks for a lackluster BORING movie, I literally fastforward watched big chunks of it bc it was dragging so much. Let MI die the painful death this movie created, too bad the first few were so good. Oh and Tom? You're 63, not 25, your naked torso isn't doesn't need to grace the screen anymore, just accept it for goodness sake.
Sentimental, talky, drawn-out, boring action and a preposterous premise.

MI: greatest movie dynasty ever.
Ethan Hunt: greatest action movie character ever
Tom Cruise: greatest action star ever

Ambicioso em seu escopo — não apenas no que diz respeito às suas quase 3 horas de duração, mas também à complexidade de suas cenas de ação —, esse é o mais grandioso capítulo da saga "Missão: Impossível" (1996-2025), conhecida por consistentemente elevar a régua do nível de produção a cada filme. A trajetória de Ethan Hunt, que começou como um conciso suspense de espionagem, atingiu proporções épicas, e esse filme nos mostra isso em todos os aspectos. "Missão: Impossível - O Acerto Final" parece mais uma jornada epopeica do que um simples filme de ação e espionagem. A trama faz interessantes e inesperadas conexões narrativas com os primeiros filmes da saga, tornando o seu universo muito mais crível e complexo, ao mesmo tempo que utiliza o pertinente impacto da inteligência artificial à nossa atual realidade para trazer à vida o mais desafiador, intimidador e assustador vilão que Hunt já enfrentou. É o meu filme preferido da saga? Não, o meu preferido segue sendo "Missão: Impossível - Nação Secreta" (2015). Ainda assim, essa é uma excelente conclusão de uma das melhores sagas de ação do cinema. Isso significa que essa é a última vez que eu quero ver Ethan Hunt? Não, eu adoraria vê-lo novamente. Mas se esse for o último capítulo da saga dele, considere-me perfeitamente satisfeito.
Love these movies! Tom Cruise is an action movie legend!!

This had so many flashbacks and context recalls to past MI movies it completely killed the flow. Ok we get it, you desperately want to tie up every single lose end but come on🙄 
MI action scenes always had a certain level of credibility as outlandish as they may have been but this went so far beyond any plot armor or suspension of disbelief that I was left shaking my head in one wtf moment after the next.
Not as good as part one. Had high hopes but disappointed.

In a world where exposition is King and repetition is....also king... this movie makes unnecessary scenes even longer in attempts to tie every character in the series together.

dull and monotonous it's attempt to make everything sound cool....

till the end sequence but by then we didn't care
Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning has some insane stunts, action, and great performances, and overall is an emotional, epic farewell.
